name: LabyRooms
description:
LabyRooms is an easy puzzle game that I have made to learn how to use Godot.

Concept

You play a little guy (with a really-simplified design) who wants to escape from the labyrinthine prison in which he is locked up.

A LabyRooms prison is made of many juxtaposed rooms. You can go out of the room where you are by exploding one of its walls with a bomb. It will create an access to another room next to the one you currently are.

Problem is that you only have a few bombs to escape from a prison, and you also have to collect a certain number of keys to unlock the way out.

Features
  • 24 different levels absolutely not sorted by their difficulty, which is irregular.
  • Classical background music to relax you while you are playing.
  • A moves counter is included: some levels have different solutions, so try to find the one which give the best score!
  • Two different choices for player movement : dynamic or square-by-square.
  • Some levels include new gameplay mechanics, like teleporters.
Credits
  • Game Design, Level Design & Programming by Tim MARTIN-VIGIER.
  • Music by Maurice RAVEL (Ma mère l'Oye, part 1).
  • Icons by Lorc, Delapouite & sbed from https://game-icons.net.
  • Font by Abelardo GONZALEZ (OpenDyslexic).
